Articles.Content:
Is it just poor google-skills or can it really be true that no one ever made an add-on with animals like the first being in space; Laika?!

It would be an awesome early game science booster!

Best regards
I do remember seeing that someone made a model of a kimpanzee (a green chimp really) though.

The only life I've seen anywhere in the Kerbolar system is on Kerbin, and consists entirely of the following: Kerbals, grass, trees, and cactus. I think there's a dead Space Kraken out on a moon of one of the outer planets, but since it's DEAD I don't consider that to be evidence of life, as no one that I know of has ever seen a living one in the wild. Felt its effects, maybe, but never SEEN one...

So, no, not super surprising that no one has done such a mod, but there's always a first time for everything, you know? ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Later! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> The only life I've seen anywhere in the Kerbolar system is on Kerbin, and consists entirely of the following: Kerbals, grass, trees, and cactus. I think there's a dead Space Kraken out on a moon of one of the outer planets, but since it's DEAD I don't consider that to be evidence of life, as no one that I know of has ever seen a living one in the wild. Felt its effects, maybe, but never SEEN one...

That's about it, there's no basis for what creatures are "canon" beyond what we can observe.

I've considered Laika in the past, but I figured a living, breathing dog would not be well received, especially if the mod is aiming to be stockalike (And some folks have major qualms about potentially harming an animal, rightfully so).

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-28T17:20:34Z" title="06/28/2015 05:20  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 28, 2015</time> by Beale**
